course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Race and Extralegal
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as POLS 385 6)
Title: Race and Extralegal Violence
(This course considers extralegal violence as a political tool of coercion, repression, and resistance. Moving from theories of onset, to outcomes, to reconciliation, this course engages with social science research as well as literary texts. Students will gain a sense of the relationship between politics, race, and extralegal violence in Georgia and throughout the United States.)
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1511, Section #: 5, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: K. Crabtree, Status: Wait List
